DataElement.preferredDefinition: Results of the tumor marker disease response assessment using the terminology associated with the normal abnormal response codelist of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Response Domain Tumor Marker Disease Response Original Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations._A substance present in or produced by a tumor or by the host, that can be used for differentiating neoplastic from normal tissue based on measurements in body fluids, secretions, cells, and/or tissues. Markers are used in diagnosis, staging and prognosis of cancer, provide an estimation of tumor burden, and serve for monitoring effects of therapy, detecting recurrence, localization of tumors, and screening in general populations._The outcome of the disease response assessment as originally received or collected.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Concepts.definition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Property.preferredName: Tumor Marker Disease Response Original Result
Property.preferredDefinition: A substance that may be found in tumor tissue or released from a tumor into the blood or other body fluids. A high level of a tumor marker may mean that a certain type of cancer is in the body. Examples of tumor markers include CA 125 (in ovarian cancer), CA 15-3 (in breast cancer), CEA (in ovarian, lung, breast, pancreas, and gastrointestinal tract cancers), and PSA (in prostate cancer).:The outcome of the disease response assessment as originally received or collected.

Concepts.definition: A substance present in or produced by a tumor or by the host, that can be used for differentiating neoplastic from normal tissue based on measurements in body fluids, secretions, cells, and/or tissues. Markers are used in diagnosis, staging and prognosis of cancer, provide an estimation of tumor burden, and serve for monitoring effects of therapy, detecting recurrence, localization of tumors, and screening in general populations.
The outcome of the disease response assessment as originally received or collected.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Normal Abnormal Response Terminology Outcome
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology associated with the normal abnormal response codelist of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM)._The result of an action.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cannot distinguish between two or more possible values in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Cannot distinguish between two or more possible values in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.

Concepts.definition: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Normal Abnormal Response Terminology Outcome
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Terminology associated with the normal abnormal response codelist of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM).:The result of an action.

Concepts.longName: CDISC SDTM Normal Abnormal Response Terminology
Concepts.definition: Terminology associated with the normal abnormal response codelist of the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM).
